intro: Mesembryanthemum maximum, commonly known as the large-leaf ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers adapted to arid environments. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday, a trait known as nyctinasty. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Mesembryanthemum maximum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
